org.jerkar.api.utils

Class JkUtilsFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.utils.JkUtilsFile

  • public final class JkUtilsFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for dealing with files.

      • copyDirContent

        public static int copyDirContent(java.io.File source,
                                 java.io.File targetDir,
                                 java.io.FileFilter filter,
                                 boolean copyEmptyDir)
        Same as copyDirContent(File, File, FileFilter, boolean, PrintStream) without stream report.

      • copyDirContent

        public static int copyDirContent(java.io.File source,
                                 java.io.File targetDir,
                                 java.io.FileFilter filter,
                                 boolean copyEmptyDir,
                                 java.io.PrintStream reportStream)
        Copies the source directory content to the target directory.
        Parameters:
        source - The directory we want copy the content from.
        targetDir - The directory where will be copied the content
        filter - Filter to decide which file should be copied or not. If you want to copy everything, use FileFilter that always return true.
        copyEmptyDir - specify if the empty dirs should be copied as well.
        reportStream - The scream where a copy status can be written. If null, no status is written.
        Returns:
        The file copied count.

      • copyDirContentReplacingTokens

        public static int copyDirContentReplacingTokens(java.io.File fromDir,
                                                java.io.File toDir,
                                                java.io.FileFilter filterArg,
                                                boolean copyEmptyDir,
                                                java.io.PrintStream reportStream,
                                                java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> tokenValues)
        Same as copyDirContent(File, File, FileFilter, boolean, PrintStream) but also replacing all token as '${key}' by their respecting value. The replacement is done only if the specified tokenValues map contains the according key.
        Parameters:
        tokenValues - a map for replacing token key by value

      • writeStringAtTop

        public static void writeStringAtTop(java.io.File file,
                                    java.lang.String content)
        Inserts the specified content at the begining of the specified file. For such a temp file is create then the original file is replaced by the temp file.

        Returns the checksum of a specified file. The algorithm may be "SHA-1" or "MD5".

      • copyFileWithInterpolation

        public static void copyFileWithInterpolation(java.io.File in,
                                             java.io.File out,
                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> replacements)
        Copies the content of the specified in file into the specified out file. While coping token ${key} are replaced by the value found in the specified replacements map.
        See Also:
        copyDirContentReplacingTokens(File, File, FileFilter, boolean, PrintStream, Map)

      • copyFileReplacingTokens

                                           java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> replacements,
                                           java.io.PrintStream reportStream)
        Same as copyFileReplacingTokens(File, File, Map, PrintStream) but writing the status in the specified reportStream.

                                          java.io.File toFile,
                                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> replacements,
                                          java.io.PrintStream reportStream)
